content.en: Algorithmic puzzle-solving: Researchers have investigated the efficiency and capabilities of various algorithms in solving different types of puzzles. The PN* algorithm has been found to outperform both other programs and human solvers in solving tsume-shogi problems. Algorithms utilizing problem domain information have proven effective in solving Kakuro puzzles, while the proposed algorithm for nonograms is faster than the commonly used DFS method. Additionally, algorithms have been developed to efficiently solve Sudoku, edge-matching, and sliding puzzles, among others.
content.da: Algoritmisk puslespilsløsning: Forskere har undersøgt effektiviteten og kapaciteterne af forskellige algoritmer til løsning af forskellige typer puslespil. PN*-algoritmen har vist sig at overgå både andre programmer og menneskelige løsere i løsning af tsume-shogi-problemer. Algoritmer, der anvender problem-domæneinformation, har vist sig effektive til løsning af Kakuro-puslespil, mens den foreslåede algoritme for nonogrammer er hurtigere end den almindeligt anvendte DFS-metode. Derudover er algoritmer blevet udviklet til effektivt at løse Sudoku, kant-matchning og skydespil, blandt andre.
